text: Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore (born January 29, 1970) Jaisalmer, Rajasthan is an Indian athlete. He is best known for shooting in the 2004 Summer Olympics in Athens. In the 2004 games, Rathore finished second in the men's double-trap shooting event. He was the first Indian to win an individual silver medal.India Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports (YAS), "Proud Moments of Indian Sports," "Rathore's Silver Medal at Athens"; retrieved 2012-7-20. ==Honours== * Arjuna Award, 2003India Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports (YAS), "Arjun Award Winners for 'Shooting'" ; retrieved 2012-7-20. ==Related pages== * Sports in India * India at the Olympics == References == ==Other websites== * Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore at Time Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Commonwealth Games medallists Category:Sport shooters Category:Olympic silver medalists for India
title: Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore
